00020 #ifndef _TUPLE_CONTAINER_H
00021 #define _TUPLE_CONTAINER_H
00022 
00023 #include "system/system.h"
00024 
00025 using namespace std;
00026 
00027 
00028 #include <vector>
00029 #include <utility>
00030 
00031 // This file contains lists of tuples, as required by table constraints. This
00032 // is required as these tuples can get big, and it's important to keep them
00033 // as compactly as possible.
00034 
00035 class LiteralSpecificLists;
00036 class Nightingale;
00037 class TupleTrieArray;
00038 class Regin;
00039 
00040 class TupleList
00041 {
00042 
00043   LiteralSpecificLists* litlists;
00044   Nightingale* nightingale;
00045   TupleTrieArray* triearray;
00046   Regin* regin;
00047   
00048   int* tuple_data;
00049   int tuple_length;
00050   int number_of_tuples;
00051   bool tuples_locked;
00052  
00053   
00054   public:
00055   
00056   LiteralSpecificLists* getLitLists();
00057   Nightingale* getNightingale();
00058   TupleTrieArray* getTries();
00059   Regin* getRegin();
00060   
00062   int* getPointer()
00063   { return tuple_data; }
00064   
00066   int size() const
00067   { return number_of_tuples; }
00068   
00069   // Get size of a particular tuple.
00070   int tuple_size() const
00071   { return tuple_length; }
00072   
00073   // This function is temporary while the new interface is being designed.
00074   vector<int> get_vector(int pos) const
00075   {
00076     vector<int> vec(tuple_length);
00077     for(int i = 0; i < tuple_length; ++i)
00078       vec[i] = tuple_data[pos * tuple_length + i];
00079     return vec;
00080   }
00081   
00082   TupleList(const vector<vector<int> >& tuple_list) : litlists(NULL), 
00083     nightingale(NULL), triearray(NULL), regin(NULL),  tuples_locked(false)
00084   {
00085     number_of_tuples = tuple_list.size();
00086     tuple_length = tuple_list[0].size();
00087     tuple_data = new int[number_of_tuples * tuple_length];
00088     for(int i = 0; i < number_of_tuples; ++i)
00089       for(int j = 0; j < tuple_length; ++j)
00090       { tuple_data[i * tuple_length + j] = tuple_list[i][j]; }
00091     finalise_tuples();
00092   }
00093   
00094   TupleList(int _numtuples, int _tuplelength) : litlists(NULL),
00095      nightingale(NULL), triearray(NULL), regin(NULL), tuple_length(_tuplelength),
00096     number_of_tuples(_numtuples), tuples_locked(false)
00097   { tuple_data = new int[number_of_tuples * tuple_length]; }
00098   
00099   const int* operator[](int pos) const
00100   { return get_tupleptr(pos); }
00101   
00102   const int* get_tupleptr(int pos) const
00103   { 
00104     D_ASSERT(pos >= 0 && (pos < number_of_tuples || (number_of_tuples==0 && pos==0)));
00105     return tuple_data + pos*tuple_length;
00106   }
00107   
00108 
00109   
00111   vector<int> dom_smallest;
00113   vector<int> dom_size;
00114   
00116    int literal_num;
00117   
00119   vector<vector<int> > _map_vars_to_literal;
00120   
00122   vector<pair<int,int> > _map_literal_to_vars;
00123   
00125   int get_literal(int var_num, DomainInt dom_num)
00126   {
00127      D_ASSERT(var_num >= 0 && var_num < tuple_size());
00128      D_ASSERT(dom_num >= dom_smallest[var_num] && 
00129               dom_num <= dom_smallest[var_num] + dom_size[var_num]);
00130     return _map_vars_to_literal[var_num][checked_cast<int>(dom_num - dom_smallest[var_num])]; 
00131   }
00132   
00133   pair<int,int> get_varval_from_literal(int literal)
00134   { return _map_literal_to_vars[literal]; }
00135 
00137   void finalise_tuples()
00138   {
00139     if(tuples_locked)
00140       return;
00141     tuples_locked = true;
00142 
00143     int arity = tuple_size();   
00144 
00145     // Set up the table of tuples.
00146     for(int i = 0; i < arity; ++i)
00147     {
00148       if(size() == 0)
00149       {
00150         dom_smallest.push_back(0);
00151         dom_size.push_back(0);
00152       }
00153       else
00154       {
00155         int min_val = get_tupleptr(0)[i];
00156         int max_val = get_tupleptr(0)[i];
00157         for(int j = 1; j < size(); ++j)
00158         {
00159           min_val = mymin(min_val, get_tupleptr(j)[i]);
00160           max_val = mymax(max_val, get_tupleptr(j)[i]);
00161         }
00162         dom_smallest.push_back(min_val);
00163         dom_size.push_back(max_val - min_val + 1);
00164       }
00165     }
00166 
00167     int dom_size_size = dom_size.size();
00168     _map_vars_to_literal.resize(dom_size_size);
00169     // For each variable / value pair, get a literal
00170     int literal_count = 0;
00171 
00172     for(int i = 0; i < dom_size_size; ++i)
00173     {
00174       _map_vars_to_literal[i].resize(dom_size[i] + 1);
00175       for(int j = 0; j <= dom_size[i]; ++j)
00176       {
00177         _map_vars_to_literal[i][j] = literal_count;
00178         _map_literal_to_vars.push_back(make_pair(i, j + dom_smallest[i]));
00179         D_ASSERT(get_literal(i, j + dom_smallest[i]) == literal_count);
00180         D_ASSERT(get_varval_from_literal(literal_count).first == i);
00181         D_ASSERT(get_varval_from_literal(literal_count).second == j + dom_smallest[i]); 
00182         ++literal_count;
00183       }
00184     }
00185     literal_num = literal_count;
00186   }
00187 
00188 };
00189 
00190 class TupleListContainer
00191 {
00192   std::vector<TupleList*> Internal_TupleList;
00193 
00194 public:
00195   TupleList* getNewTupleList(int numtuples, int tuplelength)
00196   {
00197     TupleList* tuplelist_ptr = new TupleList(numtuples, tuplelength);
00198     Internal_TupleList.push_back(tuplelist_ptr);
00199     return tuplelist_ptr;
00200   }
00201 
00202   TupleList* getNewTupleList(const vector<vector<int> >& tuples)
00203   { 
00204     TupleList* tuplelist_ptr = new TupleList(tuples);
00205     Internal_TupleList.push_back(tuplelist_ptr);
00206     return tuplelist_ptr;
00207   }
00208 
00209   TupleList* getTupleList(int num)
00210   { return Internal_TupleList[num]; }
00211 
00212   int size()
00213   { return Internal_TupleList.size(); }
00214 };
00215 
00216 
00218 class LiteralSpecificLists
00219 {
00220 public:
00221   TupleList* tuples;
00222   
00224   vector<vector<vector<int> > > literal_specific_tuples;
00225   
00226   LiteralSpecificLists(TupleList* _tuples) : tuples(_tuples)
00227   { 
00228       tuples->finalise_tuples();
00229       // For each literal, store the set of tuples which it allows.
00230       for(unsigned i = 0; i < tuples->dom_size.size(); ++i)
00231       {
00232         for(int j = tuples->dom_smallest[i]; 
00233                 j <= tuples->dom_smallest[i] + tuples->dom_size[i];
00234                  ++j)
00235         {
00236           vector<vector<int> > specific_tuples;
00237           for(int k = 0; k < (*tuples).size(); ++k)
00238           {
00239             if((*tuples)[k][i] == j)
00240               specific_tuples.push_back((*tuples).get_vector(k));
00241           }
00242           literal_specific_tuples.push_back(specific_tuples);
00243           //D_ASSERT(literal_specific_tuples.size() - 1 == get_literal(i,j));
00244         }
00245       }
00246   }
00247 };
00248 
00249 inline LiteralSpecificLists* TupleList::getLitLists()
00250 {
00251   if(litlists == NULL)
00252     litlists = new LiteralSpecificLists(this);
00253   return litlists;
00254 }
